Reviews.Title: “Classic Hotel with Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: RMA999
Reviews.Content: I worked in the hotel industry over 20 years and I can honestly say this was one of the best hotels I've ever stayed in. The lighting was 3-stage and bright, the shower had good water pressure and didn't seem flow restricted, the overall service of the staff was outstanding. We were in New York on vacation. The location was good in that it is just a short walk to Central Park or the Subway, yet still quiet and peacful. I would definately stay at this hotel again and tell all of my friends to stay here as well for a true New York classic hotel experience!

Reviews.Title: “Shabby without the Chic”
Reviews.Author: Tommal
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately I did not write a review at the time of our visit because I rarely wrote reviews at that time. However, this one has been grating on me ever since. We stayed at the Carlyle for a weekend at Christmas 2009 as a present from our daughter. My biggest disappointment was the treatment we received from the staff. Because we didn't have bundles of money to hand out to staff in tips for bringing us a few slices of toast and opening a door, we felt that the service we received was non existent. In fact it felt like we were shunned. We did tip but obviously not enough. The first room we were booked into was nice but not the one that my daughter paid for. Our second room was also nice but some of the furnishings were old and worn (not something you would expect from a 5* hotel). On booking out, although my daughter had already paid for our room, we were still charged. After some discussion the bill was put right. The limousine that we booked to take us back to the airport did not turn up. We spoke to the receptionist who told us 'don't worry the hotel has a limousine that can take you' She was obviously new because , when the car did not turn up after another 15 minutes, she was no longer at the reception and we were told to go to the concierge and no further mention was made of the courtesy car. The concierge tried twice to make contact with the company supplying the Limousine but eventually offered to arrange a taxi. We paid out $100 for a 15 minute ride. So, if your Tony and Cherie Blair, John Malkovich or a Rock star, all staying at the hotel the same time as us, you would be ok. Anyone else - forget it.

Reviews.Title: “Club Carlyle”
Reviews.Author: Mary60898
Reviews.Content: We were lucky to get tickets to see Christine Ebersolle at the club inside the Carlyle. What a great find. The room is the perfect size to enjoy such a great talent. We were two tables back from the stage and you felt like you with a group of friends at a dinner party. The hotel has a great bar to enjoy before the show and they also have live music. Famous, romantic, fun!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Classic 5 star luxury with perfect service”
Reviews.Author: Gudleiv
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a classic 5 star upper east side luxury experience - look no further. I always prefer upper east or SoHo locations when staying in New York. The Carlyle is my favorite NYC hotel. Whereas the Mandarin Oriental (second best 5 star in NYC) has got a fantastic location and nice rooms, the feeling of classic 5 star tradition blended with the difference in crowd means that the ambience is different in a positive way. From the head concierge that actually knows it all and has been around for a long time in the same hotel, bartenders that makes cocktails the hard way from scratch into perfection till the SPA that is somewhat smaller in size having been fitted into an old building, but designed by someone banned by any 5 star chain hotel due to their extravagance in spending cash on details - the hotel will impress you! Yes, some of the rooms are smaller than you might want, and some are older than I like (somewhat dated), but you feel good being there. There are lots of good local restaurants in the area that makes really good food frequented by locals rather than tourists and the hip crowd - the concierge knows them all...

Reviews.Title: “Class all the way...”
Reviews.Author: LivingWell
Reviews.Content: The Carlyle is one of the last classic, top drawer hotels in Manhattan. Built in the 1930s, the hotel is now a blend of Art Deco, 18th century French and expensive modernism that somehow all comes together to create a uniquely luxurious environment. I stayed here for one night through Amex Platinum Card Travel which meant I was upgraded to a charming room on the 21st floor -- with terrace! Not large but tasteful, quiet and very comfortable, with every possible amenity. (My only complaint: a hair dryer so loud I had to put foam stopples in my ears to use it.) Very polite and attentive staff, from the front desk to the elevator operators to the dining room waiters. I ate dinner here and had the best coq au vin I have EVER tasted, France included. You really do feel you are in 'the lap of luxury' here, luxury as it should be: tasteful, thoughtful and discrete. The Carlyle remains what upper class used to mean.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeds Expectations”
Reviews.Author: coopersouthsalem
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in many hotels in NYC including the best reviewed and highest priced. The overall experience at the Carlyle is superior to any of them.

Reviews.Title: “Proper old fashioned excellence in uptown New York”
Reviews.Author: gertrudeLondon
Reviews.Content: This hotel situated in the smart upper east side of New York does everything to restore one's faith in proper hotel management and attention to detail. Everything works the way it should. You are taken up and down in the lift by a smart bell boy and service in every way is what this hotel is about! The rooms are large with incredibly comfortable beds with soft pillows and lovely linen and you can actually see to read at night unlike some of these ultra trendy hotels where it is so dark you need a torch to negotiate your way to the bathroom. We loved the bar area where you can have any form of meal or drink and the feeling is darkly Moroccan and very comfortable or the Cafe Carlyle where you have dinner and Caberet (if you are lucky Woody Allen performs) but if not, it's usually someone well known. This is definitely our favourite hotel in New York and the surrounding area is great fun too - very good coffee at Nespresso a few blocks down from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Exeptional Place to Propose Marriage”
Reviews.Author: Lee B
Reviews.Content: I chose the Carlyle to propose marriage. What a wonderful evening we had -- the exquisitely appointed room with stunning terrace, champagne and strawberries, outstanding dinner and breakfast delivered to our door, bubble baths in the soaking tub, warm and friendly staff. All around a fabulous place to stay for a special night. And very gay friendly!!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish but dated”
Reviews.Author: Jot21
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2bd suite at the Carlyle for 10 days over Thanksgiving and left with mixed feelings. The Good: location, the quiet and sublime lobby, the concierge especially Dwight, the residential feel of the place, good mattress and pillows but not excellent, good cappucino's. The Bad: small bathrooms with zero luxury as in no heated towel bars, no heated floors, no oversized tubs, no counter space around the sinks, no dimmers on the switches. The closets : pretty good sized but mediocre layout, rooms are not very well decorated, ceilings are not high enough and the interior hallways are on the narrow side. The Ugly: every computer and iPad has to pay 14.95 a night for Internet which in my case meant 4 laptops and I was already spending a few thousands night for our suite. They alculated breakfast in our sitting room the most expensive possible way which meant 150$ for breakfast for 2 and I don't eat eggs. I enjoyed the Park view from the table and chairs on our wrap around terrace and I loved the linen sheets but both these were requested in advance and were expected and neither was there when we arrived and it took a few alls plus the intervention of our concierge travel Svc in NYC to get done. I think on my next trip I am going to stay at the Plaza Athenee. I still can't get over the pathetic gym with no bathroom and the sad bathrooms in our rooms of course it didn't help we had just left the Ritz in Madrid and the Berkeley in London which beat the pants off the Carlyle and the 2bd room suites were 20-25% less incl vat. The real problem with the Carlyle is it is not that luxurious.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Suite”
Reviews.Author: NVRam123
Reviews.Content: We had a great two night stay at the Carlyle. We booked through Amex Fine Hotels and Resorts and were upgraded to a suite on the 10th floor when we checked in (Room 1020). It was a very spacious, elegant 2 room suite with 2 bathrooms and a teeny kitchen. The bed was very comfortable. The only drawbacks were no view to speak of and the bathrooms are quite small in this room. We had room service breakfast which was great though completely overpriced. A glass of oj for $11? Come on! Service was great-when I asked for a spoon through room service one was at our door in 1 minute. Not sure if we'll be back -there are so many great hotels in New York!

Reviews.Title: “Oozes Class”
Reviews.Author: blairelliot
Reviews.Content: This hotel is classic old New York yet quite affordable. The staff treat the guests exceptionally well without looking at you blatantly for a tip after every service provided. The bar is a gorgeous and the spa is small but luxurious.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing restaurant”
Reviews.Author: calatrava
Reviews.Content: The Carlyle retaurant is hailed as one of the last bastions of traditional haute cuisine.Whilst there were small glimpses of good food the overall experience is mediocre at best.The beef wellington was excellent but my daughters lamb was overcooked and indeed dried out.The creme brulee was not caramalised but burnt.The vegetables were soggy. A dining experience is not just the food and this is were The Carlyle restaurant really fails-the staff were mostly snooty and reserved and we felt unwelcome from the moment we arrived starting with an unobserved/unacknowledged wait at the Maitre`d s plinth. Save your money-there are far better restaurants in New York City.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful lobby, rooms need overhaul (and a good wash)”
Reviews.Author: Kirkberta
Reviews.Content: My daughters and I spent three nights here in October. Usually I stay at the Surrey, but I thought I would give this hotel a try, because I heard they had renovated the rooms. The photos on the website looked amazing. I booked some sort of suite and they upgraded me to, I guess, a bigger one--and it was huge, no doubt about it. There was even a grand piano. Unfortunately, it wasn't that comfortable...or clean. The furniture was old and sparse, and it was too small for the rooms. The couch in the living room looked downright manky. Through the holes in the radiator covers (which were large and very visible from the couch) you could see big piles of lint and scuzz. The bed was lovely and the bed linens were absolutely first quality, but the lumpy brown carpet made the room feel old. And the bathrooms (two full and one half) seemed either old or improperly cleaned. There were lines of black (fungus?) around the caulking. Where are they hiding the beautiful suites pictured on the website?! Were only some of the rooms renovated? Did they run out of money and do a more thorough job on some rooms than others? And why have people employed full-time pushing elevator buttons when there is such a problem with cleaning and maintenance? That seems truly bizarre to me. On the upside, the hotel has a great Upper East Side location, walking distance from the Met and other wonderful museums. The bar/restaurant is fun and very old New York. And the staff is sweet. But this hotel can't hold a candle to the newer or more thoroughly renovated luxury hotels in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, but . . .”
Reviews.Author: markhottawa
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights over Thnksgvg Day holiday. Wonderful old-style NYC hotel, top quality amenities (bed, soaps, etc etc etc) BUT . . . charging $15 per day for wi-fi access in a room costing almost $1,000 a night all in is too cheap for words. I think you simply have to adjust your expectations in NYC hotels. We thought we had and although we were taken aback at first with the tiny room (and especially tiny bathroom), we were won over by the top quality furnishings and the relative silence of the upper east side. The staff are almost TOO friendly (where do you see elevator attendants anymore, although I suspect they are required not so much as a luxury but more to keep the travelling riff-raff from running around on floors reserved for permanent residents). The view to the south from our 31st floor was almost worth the room price in itself, but as luxury hotels go, we have had more value for money at the Waldorf and the Standard, and the Peninsula in Chicago. Unfortunately, elevators are also very tiny (old-style) and apparently don't have room for the usual luggage trolleys, so the bell staff sort of work in teams to move your luggage by hand - kind of weird and inefficient, but unfailingly polite and gracious. Also, the old walls are very thin, so that you can easily hear a normal conversation the the adjacent room (and when you share your floor with the sort of inconsiderate boors who ought not to be staying there in the first place and can't grasp the concept of considerate quiet at 0700 on a holiday morning, then you REALLY realize how thin the walls are, but you can't blame all that on the hotel.) We might return for the location and the wonderful old-style class and charm, but we might also check out The Mark in the same location. Even though I didn't even use it - I had my own handheld - I was very irritated by the effrontery of charging extra for wireless in such an expensive hotel room but maybe The Mark is the same . . . ?

Reviews.Title: “A Timeless Classic”
Reviews.Author: Vegas041610
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for 4 nights in late september. The hotel itself is very beautiful. The rooms are very spacious and cozy. Everything about the hotel is trying to show it's class and it works. They even have men working in the elevator pressing the buttons for you (which I actually found annoying, especially since they only operate 1-2 elevators at a time instead of all 4 and sometimes you had to wait for the elevator a couple of minutes). The spa is nice. The location is spot on on upper east side and only few minutes walk to Central Park. The service level at the hotel is exceptional. This kind of hotel is perhaps not my first choice but I can understand why people like it. The biggest flaw was the sleep quality. Eventhough I was at the end of my floor I still could hear alot of noise during the night/early morning when people where walking to the elevators or their rooms. Considering how expensive the hotel is, not getting a good night sleep was a major let down. All in all a nice hotel at a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Classic charm, a dying breed in New York”
Reviews.Author: Mazy M
Reviews.Content: I was on a business trip in New York which I combined with a family vacation, travelling with my wife, 3 kids and a nanny. The hotel is situated a block away from Central Park and along the shops of Madison Avenue. Our stay was great, the hotel staff really tried to look after us and surprised the kids with a special treat for Halloween, decorating the rooms with spider webs, pumpkins and the like. Best of all, when you're staying at the Carlyle, you have a porter in each elevator (which can be a bit slow when it's a busy time of the day), the Bemelman Bar had Paul McCartney show up when we were there, the Carlyle Cafe features Woody Allen performance every Monday. Rooms are good size for NY, although bathrooms only have one sink! I loved the hotel and will be back, very child friendly too!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location in NYC”
Reviews.Author: R D
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at the Carlyle. As someone who loves walking, the location is perfect for walking to the Metropolitan Museum of Art and Central Park. Everyone from the front desk staff to the doormen were always smiling, helpful and friendly. The rooms could use a little updating but the bathrooms were gorgeous. Overall a fantastic stay and would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Timeless elegance and practical comforts”
Reviews.Author: BriggsCass
Reviews.Content: We spent a romantic weekend at the Carlyle on recommendation from a friend who raves about their service. Even though we were primed to expect the best, the hotel exceeded our expectations in all categories. The Carlyle is a European-style hotel decorated with a perfect, elegant blend of modern and classic -- everywhere you look it is relaxing and beautiful (and their floral arrangements, including gorgeous live orchids, are from one of the finest florists in Manhattan). Every single member of staff we encountered was not just courteous and helpful, but genuinely friendly, and happy to go above and beyond. We had bad weather our second night and needed to run a quick errand a few blocks away, so we asked them to call us a taxi -- instead, they put us in the hotel's courtesy car. The next day, we were running late for an appointment and needed something picked up about 10 blocks away -- they went and got the item and put it safely in my room. Our waiter pointed out the charming details in the hand-painted wallpaper in the dining area. The elevator attendants and front desk staff remembered our names. These are all just small examples of the seamlessly fabulous service they offer. Our room was superb -- comfortable bed, good water pressure in the shower, spotlessly clean. Room service was excellent. The location was perfect for us as well -- a quieter part of the city right by Central Park. All in all, a dream.

Reviews.Title: “The Carlyle...Class, Service, and Cost”
Reviews.Author: rhmedsker
Reviews.Content: The Carlyle is one of a quickly vanishing breed...a hotel which lives up to its reputation for high quality service, accommodations, and ambiance. From the moment you step into the lobby, you know this is not the Marriott Marquis or the "W". From the marble floors to the art to the impeccable service, it is first class. The 'superior suite' was just that with large living room and large bedroom. The bathroom, although very modern and totally mirrored, was miniscule even by NY standards. The decor in the Carlyle Gallery (restaurant) is Moorish and lovely, not over the top like a lot of 'Bogart-wanna-be's. Serving lighter fare, the Gallery is the better place to eat at the Carlyle. The main restaurant's decor is also marvelous; however, the seating is crowded and there is no way to not be involved in the conversation next to you. The food is fairly over-priced and not that good. Location, Location, Location..that is the major problem. Unless you plan to go to Central Park and that is it, brace yourself for lots of taxi expense and long travel time to the theaters. This is not a hotel for a taste of Broadway.

Reviews.Title: “A major disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Bruton23
Reviews.Content: When you book a refurbished junior suite do you expect a bathroom ? Well this hotel evidently doesn't feel the need to tell it's guests that a tiny shower with a basin is what's on offer .... Oh and of course we'll move you but to a dirty and depressing smoking floor which stinks . So we cut and ran ... Across the road to the Mark , a wonderful modern clean friendly hotel . The Carlyle is a disgrace and they had the gall to send us a computer generated letter thanking us for staying there!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable room, very nice reception but this is definitely not a 5 stars hotel”
Reviews.Author: kizkouz
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a superior room with view on the Madison Avenue on the 10th floor. The welcome from the reception was very nice and warm and the grooms in the elevators were also very attentionate. But we were first chocked by the rundown state of the room as we came in. We had very high expectations from the 5 stars rating of the hotel and the beautiful pictures on the hotel's website. Although the linen and the towels were excellent quality (and changed every day!) and the beds very comfortable, the rest of the furniture looked old and run down. The bathroom was the worst part: we think that this needs major renovation. For instance there were dark stains (fungus??) on the shower head and the corners of the bath tub. The paint on the ceiling of the bathroom was getting off. The closing of the bath tub was missing. Last but not least, the bath tub was not properly cleaned every day: it was simply washed with water and one could see that no soap or special product was used. Besides, we were awaken 2 times by the cleaning lady. Once she rang several times in the morning while she knew we were still in the room. She tried to give one of us a high pile of linen to put on the bed (we then politely asked her to put them herself inside!!) as she didn't feel like coming back for that later. We found it very inappropriate and disturbing. She just walked in and out while we were still busy getting ready for the day. We were basically happy with our stay in the Carlyle because: 1) the room was comfortable, 2) reception was nice, 3) location was excellent and safe. But the points mentioned above make this hotel not worth the 5 stars and regular prices for the quality offered.

Reviews.Title: “Not good service”
Reviews.Author: David W
Reviews.Content: This hotel may have a 5 star rating, but it does not have 5 star service with the exception of Dwight at the concierge who was a big help to me.

Reviews.Title: “Adorable&Helpful Staff, Great ambience in lobby,Awesome/Energetic band in restaurant”
Reviews.Author: jos_9
Reviews.Content: We had just checked into our hotel rm - about 20mins in when we felt the Aug23rd earthquake on our 10 floor rm, the hotel was very proficient at informing us. We felt totally safe. That night we went to a Yankees game, Rylie at the reception was kind enough to print up the directions via subway for us - very helpful for us first visit in the City. The next day we went to the Woodbury Commons Outlets and another very helpful reception staffer instructed us on how and where to get our bus tickets and coupon book which rocked! the lobby is reminiscent of the art deco movement. It was always great when descending into the lobby in the evenings you could hear the band in the restaurant cranking classics with a real NY/Sinatra high energy feel - wonderful for the ambience. We had dinner there one night and the food was great and the place was full of locals and tourists alike. All of the elevator conductors where adorable older men that always made quick great conversation. We were upgraded upon check in which is always a bonus and much appreciated. We stayed for 5 days, and were there for the Hurricane Irene as well - but were completely unaffected it by it in our area- even though the hotel was great at setting up an emergency plan "just in cast" The location was great for us, we could see CentralPark from our corner suite. The hotel is on the corner of 76th and Madison Ave so the shopping was fab! From Creed to JonathanAdler to Frette and all the big name designers Gucci, Valentino, E.Armani. I was worried that any room would be loud in NY, but soon as our rm door was closed it was silent in our room which I highly valued. All in all with all the options available re: hotels in NY I am satisfied with my stay at the Carlyle, the only thing I raised a brow to was the charges for wireless internet - that being said the reception staff was ALWAYS ready to print anything we every needed and the the business centre is comp as well. The rooms and paint could use some updating, it would only add to the charm of this great hotel and its staff. Oh by the way... the toiletries are Kiehls... for a product junkie like me... I thought I should mention that ; )

Reviews.Title: “not that nice”
Reviews.Author: WJ60
Reviews.Content: We splurged to stay here...usually we opt for a less fancy hotel in NYC..but we got a discounted price over labor day. This place wasnt worth the extra money. We found the room at the Carlyle quite scruffy...banged up old furniture...tired decor....nice linen though and a comfortable bed. Our bill had an error but that was corrected quickly by email. On the checkout day someone came into the room before check out time, while we were having breakfast and before we had checked out (our luggage was still there in the room) and dumped all the new linen and towels in the room and took the tip we had set out. That's tacky...made us feel rushed to leave...In the year 2011 a hotel should KNOW when guests have checked out and when they haven't...it's not rocket science. We wouldn't stay there again. We actually like a hotel in the 40's or 50's better anyway for shopping, theater, access to more than one subway line, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Old Style Charm”
Reviews.Author: ROTCHKO
Reviews.Content: It is always fascinating to sleep on pillows with your monogram and to be part of the history. Carlyle is one of those old school hotels rich of charm and tradition. The service is attentive, amenities in the room are cool, the staff is kind and nice, in one world the make feel you like home (that for me is really super important). I like the breakfast, maybe less the restaurant and the noise in the room, but at the end New York is the city that does not sleep!!! In a city crawded with fake super chic and cool hotel is nice to have a place that is still authentic and genuine

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Shawne K
Reviews.Content: Having never travelled to New York, not knowing where to stay and being overwhelmed by the number of choices, it was just the luck of the draw that we ended up at the Carlyle. The location was PERFECT. Just steps from central park and a nice leisurely walk to all of the hustle and bustle, providing a quiet retreat to return to after a night of bright lights and honking cars. The service was IMPECCABLE. We were in and out quickly at both check in and check out and were even treated to a nice upgrade. We were celebrating a birthday and were welcomed to our room with a beautiful plate of fruit and a lovely birthday pastry with a chocolate birthday plaque. The view was AMAZING. We were facing Madison Avenue and got to enjoy it every morning from our enclosed patio room. The room was DAZZLING. Clean, crisp and all of the amenities one could possibly need. We got a great deal on one of the travel sites and will recommend this hotel time and time again and canâ€™t wait to go back ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay - can't wait to visit again”
Reviews.Author: cityboy1955
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my family as part of our 25th Weddinng Ann. Had a great time. I had previously stayed here on a business trip some 2 years ago. Hotel met our expectations - comfortable, clean and great people working there. Nothing was too much trouble. They even had even put some cake in our room when we arrived to celebrate our anniversary. It was such a nice touch. I can't thank everyone at the Carlyle for a great stay - I cant wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Elegant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hicynthia13
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Carlye it is a lovely historic hotel, my room was huge with a beautiful marble bathroom. The hotel is located in a quiet location off Central Park, excellent for shopping on Madison Ave. I found all the staff to be very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Classy NYC”
Reviews.Author: svalkenborg
Reviews.Content: Very caring staff when checking in. They offered me an upgrade to a deluxe room which was very enjoyable when travelling during 12 hours. My room was nicely decorated, had a beautiful entrance corridor and a full mirorred bathroom(which was great by the way)

Reviews.Title: “Wow - Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Gums
Reviews.Content: We went to New York for a special occasion. To celebrate a 21st. A celebration type hotel was called for. Of course in the States the 21st is a big thing as alcohol becomes legal. Usually we have stayed in Midtown but this time we went to the posh end of town and the Upper East Side. We booked The Carlyle. Although we were a little concerned that it might be a little stuffy we plumped for it because of its history, its reputation, its fame for jazz and its proximity to Central Park which was condsidered a bonus bearing in mind we were going in summer. We were thankful that we had as the temperatures reached staggering highs and a stroll through the trees of the Park was welcome on more than one occasion. What then about the hotel itself. Quite simply it is, as the Americans would say, awesome. In a city which can at times be revolting in its brashness and ability to go completely OTT this is a place that is luxurious yet measured, restrained, and subtle. It is comfortable with being what it is - that is - pure class - and does not need to shout it from the its very high rooftop. We were greated by the special events manager who had responded to my request for adjoining rooms. She gave us only one room key on arrival however - saying some finishing touches were to be done to the birthday girl's room. We soon found out that these touches were the delivery of complimentary Champagne and cake to get the celebrations off to a wonderful start. We spent time in the bar - birthday girl showing that her 3 years of UK drinking practice had not gone to waste - as she sampled a number of fantastically executed cocktails. We listened to the relaxing jazz. We admired the extraordinary murals on the walls. We had breakfast in the Restaurant - once I had been sent back to the room as I was wearing shorts which were not acceptable - quite right too - I felt my self saying. We sampled the lounge where it is said the great and good of yesterday, the Hepburns and Kennedys would meet, and where the great and good of today clearly still do. The service throughout the hotel was impeccable, the food excellent, the drink better. The rooms old style proper total comfort with all the amenities you could need, the ipod dock and flat screen TV sitting well with the French influenced furniture and marble bathrooms. The hotel lobby and public areas understated in elegance with great art and objects and yet a well equipped and complimentary business centre.. If you want urban cool and modern minimalism dont stay here. The Carlyle is a hotel of a different age, an age of classic beauty and refined living, but it retains its relevance in today's world by being exemplary in every way. It is an oasis from both the constant rush of the city that never sleeps and the world which seems never to even take a breath. It is marvellous.

Reviews.Title: “Service? for whom exactly does the bell toll???”
Reviews.Author: LizzyJohn
Reviews.Content: We chose the Carlyle for its location and reputation. And it is a great location - only a few blocks from the Met and a stroll away from the shops on Madison. But it is living on a past reputation which it no longer deserves. We arrived too early to check in on a very wet day. We were promised a phone call when our room was ready but otherwise we braved the heavy downpour. Hours went by and no phone call. In desperation we returned to be greeted by reception staff who had no trace of us or our request for a call. Despite it being past 3pm (the normal check in time) there was still no room for us. We were given an upgraded room - which in fairness was just lovely. But the hotel's reception desk staff seem more interested in talking to each other than assisting. More than once we stood patiently waiting for attention only to be ignored. 'Hello??....' The last straw? On the last day we rang down to ask for assistance with baggage. 'Of course, someone will be up directly...' 25 mins later with a plane to catch we struggled downstairs ourselves. The reception was deserted except for the reception desk clerk filing his nails and two uniformed bellhops standing idly by ... chatting... Don't trouble yourselves gentlemen, we won't be back...

Reviews.Title: “The room we got was Huge!”
Reviews.Author: LoveNYC41436
Reviews.Content: My family of three used our airline miles to book a room for one night. We asked for a non smoking room, that was our only choice given online. When we called to confirm, we asked to face the street and have a view. When we arrived way before check in time, to drop off our bags and sightsee, the very nice lady at the front desk asked us if we wanted to see if our room was ready at that time. It was not, but she even called our cell phone later when it was. She told us we had been upgraded and the room included a renovated bath. It was a terrific room and was enormous. VERY CLEAN! The bath had a separate shower and tub and good lighting. A little mildew along the caulk in the shower, but easily overlooked. The bed was the best thing about the room, no smell of any kind, it was like sleeping on a new mattress and pillow. I am really picky about odor, and my room was very fresh!!! The view was not so hot, just the building across the street, but the room was so pretty, I did not care. The staff was very nice and friendly. They stored our bags when we checked out for us. I would love to stay there again someday! Great location, very quiet at night, and right near the Met museum and in a great part of town.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel from a lost era!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jomled
Reviews.Content: The Calyle is the type of place you expected the Vanderbuilts and Astors to stay at. The service was fantastic. We have brunch in their restaurant, I have to say that other than being in Europe I have not had a better brunch. Very very expensive - $500 per night is very common. Its a great experience and a real treat to be treated like royalty. Book it for a special occasion. Great restuarants for dinner nearby on the Avenues and the Met is a three block walk. Great stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: Hefferz
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a lovely trip to the Carlyle. It's a beautiful hotel with stunning deco and interiors. The room was comfortable. We had fantastic views over Manhattan and Central Park from our 23rd floor room. Breakfast was good but the service was a little slow and inattentive. Bemelman's bar was a great place to enjoy an evening listening to live jazz music. This was the best part of our stay at the hotel. The hotel had misplaced our booking of a car to pick us up from JFK, but they offered us a complimentary car on our return to JFK as an apology. Staff were always friendly and able. We had a very good time. We may return but may also try one of New York's other 5 star hotels. We have stayed at the Ritz and the Plaza previously and I would put it roughly on a par with those hotels, though the location is not as good in our opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Quintessential Elegant Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: CAtravellerz
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at The Carlyle. We stayed once in adjoining rooms with our kids, but this time went just the two of us for a weekend of theater and exploring the City. Both stays were excellent. The hotel itself from it's architecture, to the amazing art in the lobby, to the white gloved elevator operators is old New York at its best. The service is so polite and unobtrusive it seems to come almost from another era. We first stayed in 2 rooms with our kids and these rooms, called "Unrennovated" were absolutely enormous. We didn't even need 2 rooms. Each must have been 800 sq ft with a large walk-in closet and kitchenette. Great w/ kids. THIS time we stayed in one of the rennovated rooms, which was lovely but much much much smaller. THE LOCATION simply can't be beat. You are just steps away from the Metropolitan Museum of Art and the Whitney, Central Park and The Guggenheim, also the Neue Gallerie. WE WILL DEFINITELY BE BACK.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MDTMET
Reviews.Content: We arrived early on sunday and were given a room within 1 hour, the room was very nice but that night we had a rest less night due to the loud ac unit. The next morning i made the desk manager aware and were given a choice of 3 different rooms to which we could move to very nice of them. We chose to moved to the 31first floor with a very nice view of central park. With this in mind i would recommend this hotel if you can get a deal as i did,a good deal. It is usually very high room cost $700.00 to $1000.00 search for under $ 500.00. For food deals and purchases head to second and third ave.s. Very helpful staff and elavator operators, bus lines are very close. Hope this will help you.

Reviews.Title: “Very Convienent and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: HollyGoLightly046
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because it was near Central Park, the major museums I was planning to visit, and Madison Avenue shopping. I enjoyed staying here very much. The hotel is very quiet and comfortable. I listened to live music at the bar downstairs, Bemelman's. I was very happy to be able to walk right over to all the attractions that I was interested in, I didn't have to take a cab anywhere while I was in NYC. The hotel staff are helpful. The toiletries provided were great, the soap especially has a wonderful smell. The longer I was there, the more I liked the hotel, it really grew on me. I had to pay about $14.95 for internet per day.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel and Ambience”
Reviews.Author: Traveler0033
Reviews.Content: The Carlyle is an Upper East Side tradition. The staff was friendly and efficient, and we especially enjoyed Bemelman's Bar with the Chris Gillespie Trio playing.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury with caring staff”
Reviews.Author: Winkelreid
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 4 nights at the Carlyle in celebration of a birthday and wedding anniversary. Someone had tipped off the staff and every where we went we were wished happy birthday and anniversary, including a duet from the customer relations person and the floor manager singing happy birthday to my wife and bringing her flowers and a cake on the day. The staff was extremely attentive to all our needs and wishes and the room was lovely and quiet..we slept in till 10 am one day! An evening spent in Bemelmans' Bar was unforgettable and a long chat with Tommy the bartender was fun. We splurged on ourselves by staying here but it was well worth it and we would definitely return when we next visit NYC. Only minor complaint was a charge for in room internet access, but it is free in the business center downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance, Continuity and Service”
Reviews.Author: OrrvilleRedRider
Reviews.Content: This review updates my prior review of The Carlyle from July of 2006, and relates specifically to stays at the hotel in August and October of 2010. These were my 15th and 16th stays at the hotel, respectively. The Carlyle continues to be one of my favorite hotels, worldwide. This is a hotel of timeless elegance and gentility, with a high level of service and personal attention. Itâ€™s a hotel with staff continuity â€“ some the bell staff, room service staff and doormen are the same as on my first visit in 1992. They remember me from stay to stay, and I am warmly greeted. That continuity provides something intangible, and very valuable. During the August, 2010 visit, my wife and I had a Premiere Suite on the 4th floor, overlooking 76th Street. The suite had a half bath, kitchenette, large living room (with grand piano) and bedroom with full bath. The â€œDeluxeâ€� and â€œPremiereâ€� suite categories seem to be exactly the same except that, in the Premiere Suite category, one of the two walk-in closets has been turned into a separate shower stall, allowing a separate soaking tub. The room was very well appointed. Each of the two easy chairs and sofa in the living room were inviting and comfortable. The easy chair in the bedroom was also very comfortable. Iâ€™m picky about lighting, and all of the seating locations were well lit. The grand piano was cool to look at, but didnâ€™t serve much purpose for us. As is always the case at The Carlyle, the bedding and linen were of highest quality (Frette, I believe). The bed was excellent. I visited the hotel alone for the October, 2010 stay, and stayed in a tower room somewhere in the 20s â€“ my first opportunity to stay in the tower portion of the hotel. My view was to the east â€“ and was spectacular. The bathroom also had a window, and I could enjoy the same view while â€œseatedâ€�, so to speak. The tower room had a comfortable easy chair, with very good lighting nearby. It also had a walk-in closet. On the both stays, housekeeping was flawless. Everything happened when it was supposed to, and how it was supposed to happen. The door service and elevator service was friendly and prompt. As has always been the case at The Carlyle, the HVAC worked flawlessly during both stays, and both rooms were exceptionally quiet (this was a pleasant surprise for the 4th floor room, which I expected to pick up more of the Madison avenue traffic noise). I have some rules that guide my stays at The Carlyle. 1) I like bright rooms. Because of that, with the exception of the Premiere Suite mentioned above that was on the 4th floor, I normally stay no lower than the 8th or 9th floors. Iâ€™ve found the lower floors much darker when it come to natural light. 2) I follow my â€œold hotel ruleâ€� when I stay The Carlyle â€“ which is, never stay in the cheapest room in an old hotel, because those rooms can be very very small and/or look into air shafts. From the floor plans, I do perceive that there is at least one room on each of the lower floors that would fit into that category. 3) If breakfast is not included in my room rate, I eat breakfast elsewhere, since it is priced at a very high level. 4) Iâ€™m always very cautious about room service. Very thirsty during one summertime stay, I ordered a pitcher of Iced Tea (how much could it cost, I thought?). Thirty-nine dollars (before the tip), was the answer. I learned my lesson. The Carlyle is never cheap, although good rates can be had if one looks for them. The service has never disappointed over the past two decades. Iâ€™ve never had any failings of any the fundamentals â€“ plumbing, noise levels, electrical, HVAC, bedding, lighting and the like. It has met all of my expectations consistently throughout all of my stays. I strongly recommend The Carlyle to anyone who looks for a classic, high service hotel stay with no surprises.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience - true New York style!”
Reviews.Author: GoSTLCards6161
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed the hotel and location. They have done a wonderful job maintaining the integrity of the history of the hotel. My room was HUGE by any city's standards. Kiehls bath amenities were to die for. Service was top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Pitifully faded glory”
Reviews.Author: es335tdc
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 4 night stay in a Superior Suite at the Carlyle. I'm 60 and have stayed at fine hotels all over Europe and in major US cities. This is the worst hotel experience I've ever had. Off the entrance hallway to our suite was a kitchenette with Formica counter tops and appliances that had seen better days many years ago. The rug in the living area was stained and frayed at the edges. There was a jagged tear in the curtains that looked like it had been repaired by a child. The bathroom was completely walled in mirrors to disguise how incredibly tiny it was. I really doubt that 2 adults could have stood in the bathroom at the same time. After arrival, I called housekeeping to ask for a bucket of ice, since there are no ice machines on the floor, and finally, an hour later, on the third phone call, I just told them to forget it. Breakfast each morning in the restaurant was included in our room package and was about the quality one would expect at a Denny's. We asked to see another room and were shown a Deluxe Suite which was actually in worse physical shape than our first suite, so we just let it go. The Carlyle may have been the epitome of Art Deco splendor when it was built in 1931. In 2011, it's merely faded, tired looking, and cramped. If you really want to stay in a wonderful hotel, go stay in the Ritz Carlton in San Francisco. It, like the Carlyle, is housed in an older, historic building, but the difference in quality between the two hotels is like night and day. If you're in New York, anything would have to be better than the Carlyle.

Reviews.Title: “"Fits a certain need, somewhat disappointed"”
Reviews.Author: whitleybh
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a NY weekend of shopping and dinning. Positives - good value for 5 star in NY and good value for the location which is great, upper east side. Continued positives - Captures Old New York with some really nice old world touches, elevator guys were great and along with the bellstaff and resturant guys, the only real professionals. Room - was huge for NY standards, granted we were upgraded, but really was nice, hardwood floors and charming touches. Negatives - Front desk staff was a bit amatuer hour, young people with really not a whole lot of class, not especially friendly. Conceriege was a bit off too, younger, incurrate information. Common areas are a little worn down. Did not feel like I got a true 5 star service oriented group. Save for elevator operators, bellman, and resturant. Just not a place to fall in love with, disappointing to us because we really wanted to find our "address" in NY for return trips. I am going to stick with mainstream luxury groups such as Ritz Carlton or Four Seasons, perhaps a better reviewed botique hotels. But if your in your 30s and a well healed traveler, look elsewhere, the Carlyle will disapoint.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: Draytongardens
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended a perfect place to recuperate after a surgical procedure. When I spoke to a reservationist she assured me that they would have a renovated suite with a kitchenette for me. I was given a seemingly lovely renovated one bedroom suite with a minibar, no kitchenette. Minibar frig was broken so we had to have another delivered. The heat and air-conditioning did not work in the bedroom. I ordered toast and it arrived uncovered and ice cold. The phone in the living room malfunctioned. I complained to the night manager who said he was sorry the room was not to my liking. I guess it is my fault that I don't like to eat food after it has spent a few hours in a warm frig, my fault that I become uncomfortable in stuffy, hot rooms and my fault that I find cold toast unappetizing. He also mentioned that I had too many requests Athough the hotel's night manager could use a rigorous retraining in customer relations , every service person who came to our room was polite, apologetic and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Classic style - the best of New York's hotels.”
Reviews.Author: Melanosporumandme
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here five times. The hotel expresses the best of NY grace style, from the fabulous art deco lobby to the public rooms. Not too big but not boutique and with great staff, it's the best place to stay in New York (the St Regis is good to but not at all as personal or cosy).The rooms are spacious and well kitted out with lovely soap and toiletries. Try and get a renovated room - some of the basic rooms are awaiting refurbishing. It's expensive, but worth it; book a deal including breakfast and free internet (I like whatahotel.com) - you also save on rack rates and may get a room upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Spider beetle”
Reviews.Author: shein_deborah
Reviews.Content: Beware the spider beetles in your bed at the Caryle. They look like bed bugs and they do bite. The one I found was examined by a "professional" and declared not bed bug. Took four days to be identified as said beetle, after repeated requests for information. 10 bites on torso and thigh.

Reviews.Title: “magical evening”
Reviews.Author: cmfield
Reviews.Content: spent a winter's evening at The Carlyle...dinner at Cafe Carlyle, cabaret show and overnight accomodation...using major credit card reservation service, had early check in, late check out, spa credit and breakfast....caliber of service was outstanding from start to finish...hefty price tag but generally worth it....gorgeous room, fabulous table for dinner, incredible performance by cabaret singer, outstanding service from start to finish one hitch: as hotel guest, surprised that we were hit up for 15.00/pp cover charge while standing at bar waiting for table (jazz trio on break) and were, subsequently, charged 30.00/pp to sit at table for 2nd round of drinks (this time, the trio performed)...our cover charge was greater than cost of drinks, as only 2 out of 4 had 2nd round.... ordered/picked up drinks at bar ourselves - no table service other than the bill being delivered to our table, with the added cover charge...just wasn't right...could understand if you were not hotel guest and stopping in for drinks...but, seemed excessive and definitely soured the feel of evening if you are looking for a special place for special evening, the Carlyle can be the place - just make sure you've got deep pockets... FYI: simple breakfast for two exceeded $85 -

Reviews.Title: “A luxurious, smart and efficient hotel with old fashioned charm”
Reviews.Author: madeleine_rijndorp
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at this wonderful, unique, small but beautifully run hotel. The service was exemplary. The staff were courteous, attentive and friendly. Nothing was too much trouble. Old fashioned style (if only other hotels would copy this). The lift attendants wore white gloves The flower arrangements were superp. The restaurants were fabulous, The bar was atmospheric with a great pianist. We experienced an utterly pleasurable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay when in the city”
Reviews.Author: TravelNY_10
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderfule experience from the moment we checked in until we checked out. The room was ver spacious and clean. Filled with Kiehl products. Our tub/shower seemed a littl tires and the bed was very firm, not the kind you fall into and dont want to leave. Other than that, no complaints at all. We were upgraded to a higher floor, and our room had beautiful views and truly was spacious, with a very large walk in closet and main area. We were celebrating a special occasion, and they had a sepcial dessert in the room waiting for us which was a nice touch. We had drinks downstairs before heading out for sinner. We truly could have stayed their all night...what a true New York experience. We had massages at their spa, which was great, the changing rooms were nothing special, but the treatment rooms were lovely. We had brunch the following day and the service, food and ambience was top notch. They certainly made sure our weekend was so special!

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: Felix_lechat
Reviews.Content: Charming rooms. A litle old but well kept. Impeccable service and staff. Overnight laundry. Excellent restaurants. Close to central park. Greatvfor business travel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel and Good Service”
Reviews.Author: PRCOX1963
Reviews.Content: The hotel is run in the old traditions - there are elevator operators even though the elevators have buttons - they tend to not have enough operators at peak times resulting in longer waits which I found unacceptable - the elevator operator is a nice touch, but not when it means waiting in the lobby for a long time just to get an elevator car. Room service is reasonable in this hotel though we found that the requests made were not handled correctly - however, we did not tell them of the mistakes so they had no opportunity to correct the mistakes. While we were there someone left a package on the street about a block away. The police shut the street down to investigate - not an uncommon reaction in NYC today. The hotel management was good enough to find out what was causing the commotion so we could adjust our plans.

Reviews.Title: “Not a place for non-smokers.”
Reviews.Author: bartonfinkle
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, well located, steeped in history, art, and style. Insist on an updated room because the older ones can have scratched up furniture and less that pristine carpets. The service is great; the food is delicious; the jazz bar terrific, BUT a large percentage of the rooms are residences so it cannot be a non-smoking hotel and that is evident in the air. The first room we were given (and they got the reservation completely confused) was smokey (actually there were two men in suits in the bathroom of that particular room when we entered which was awkward at best) BUT even in the updated room that had a balcony with cigarette butts on it, you could feel smoke in the air. Asthmatics, beware. Others might very well enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and VERY accomodating for a small event!”
Reviews.Author: momaTFlorida
Reviews.Content: Let me first say that I have stayed in some of the best hotels in the world but NEVER did I stay in such a fine establishment where the staff treated me like family. i chose the Carlyle for my daughter's bridal shower and the whole experience was nothing short of enchanting. I wanted an intimate space with windows and views plus impeccable service for my traveling guests. The Carlyle far exceeded my expectations in this respect, but wait, here's the best part, the room minimum was much more reasonable than other private rooms in the city! So much so that we had an opportunity to add on passed ors'devors that were to die for! During the planning process our event manager, Caitlin, was attentive and responsive to our every need. Caitlin provided us with group block discounts for those staying at the hotel, menu suggestions, layout ideas and floral recommendations. When my daughters decided that they wanted to do table arrangements, Caitlin volunteered the floral room for our use. This was totally unexpected and made the preparation for the event so much fun as we totally felt like inside staff. Caitlin also hunted down a projector for us to show a slide show during the event and the other waiters and staff members were the most friendly and professional people I have ever dealt with. When we first arrived, our room was upgraded to a two bedroom suite and myself, daughters and bridesmaids were treated to a huge sitting area for entertaining, kitchen, entrance foyer with real leather bound books plus two huge bedrooms with apartment like furnishings and fine, European linens. A fruit basket was waiting for us as well. At the event, everyone appreciated the elegant setting, delicious food and overall ambiance and mood. Even after the event was through, the hotel didn't mind the lingering guests as there was not even a suggestion to be ferried off to some other area. We did, however, retreat to the lovely sitting room in our suite for the opening of the gifts. it was the perfect place to unwind and have the convenience of a home away from home. It was even a breeze to ship off all the presents as a package assistant arrived with shipping forms and the whole lot was effortlessly transported to the package room and sent to our residence within a few days. It is really rare that you get to stay in an intimate hotel where your every need is anticipated and you are greeted by super friendly staff at all hours of the day. When my daughters went shopping, they were offered the private Mercedes and only had to tip the driver. Seriously? Where does this happen in this day and age? Honestly, anyone who thinks this hotel is stuffy and overpriced, clearly does not have an appreciation for the finer aspects of travel and entertaining away from home. Thanks, Carlyle for a truly memorable stay!

Reviews.Title: “A genuine treasure on upper east side.”
Reviews.Author: phcfinancial
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed a week, and we wishwe could have stayed a month. The Carlyle is classy without being haughty. Everyone from the elevator men to the concierge to the bartender made us feel welcome and at home. Sounds from a NY street can be a problem, but with the double windows we never heard a thing.

Reviews.Title: “Bemelmans Bar.....”
Reviews.Author: lalea
Reviews.Content: An additional comment after prior review. I found it odd that the management response did not address this. We love the Carlyle! The hotel, service, neighborhood etc. is everything we are looking for when we visit NYC. Having this said, we too find the surcharge for hotel guests in Bemelman's Bar a bit much. It is quite annoying for a guest to be subjected to what amounts to $100 cover in order to enjoy a night-cap before retiring to our $800+ room. A consideration for hotel guests would be in order and much appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Room "shabby chic" - didn't live up to its reputation for either quality or service”
Reviews.Author: Paultamsmith
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Carlyle for a friend's wedding that was taking place in the hotel. Whilst the ground floor of the hotel is undoubtedly impressive, the rarefied, or snooty, atmosphere leaves one feeling slightly uncomfortable. Our room on the 8th floor could best be described as shabby chic. It had obviously once been a very nice room but was in dire need of a makeover. We ventured into the hotel bar to find that there was a $50 dollar cover charge just to sit down, not including drinks â€“ needless to say we didnâ€™t stay. Even if I were extremely wealthy, I don't think I would welcome being ripped off in this way. However, my friend's wedding was perfect in every way, from the ceremony, to the service and food, so the Carlyle redeemed itself there. However, I wouldn't be keen to return and certainly wouldn't recommend it. Reading through some of the other recent reviews it is clear that many others have had a similar experience and I canâ€™t help thinking that there are a number of issues that the Carlyleâ€™s management needs to address as a matter of urgency if the hotel is to hang on to its reputation!

Reviews.Title: “Walk in legend on 76th”
Reviews.Author: Fonaweb
Reviews.Content: I had waited 20 long years to stay at The Carlyle, sometime art deco lodging house to assorted kings, presidents, global titans and other people that run the known universe, who once in a while find the need to stop by New York to check up on how the USA is getting along. The dreams of youth - i.e. turning up at The Carlyle as one of those people - faded long ago but I could not contain my excitement at finally consummating (along with wife and 11 year old son) my long distance love affair with the timeless legend at 76th and Madison. Was it worth the wait? Oh yes, how it truly, truly was. I am sure they run votes on this site for the best hotel in the world and there will be many with more sumptuous of everything and with a zillion more newfangled sources of gratuitous pampering. But love is blind and everything about The Carlylefor me was perfection. In the most popular city destination in the world, it was the destination. Entering The Carlyle is to enter a genuine world where fads come and go but the discreet service, Ray the doorman's anecdotes and Anastasia's soliticitous courtesy, speak of timeless values of service that were not learned in a training program last week but deliver all the charm and values of a different, less vacuous era. That service is delivered with the quiet confidence that comes from decades at the top. The rooms are all that you would expect from the average superluxury hotel. The cocktail bar is charming, the room service delicious. But it is a legend that feels just a lot more real than the competing realities. You are a guest here, not a credit card and a loyalty program. So to all you other establishments out there, well let's come back in, say, 50 years and see how you are getting on. The style, the values and the dreams of 1920s America live at this address.

Reviews.Title: “Peerless”
Reviews.Author: nowvoyager1
Reviews.Content: As and when I retire, the Carlyle stands every chance of being my new home. I have stayed there countless times and it is flawless. Service is outstanding in every respect, the staff are friendly, greet one by name and are extremely good at what they do. I now gravitate between two rooms in the Tower, both of which have recenlty been refurbished and with their jaw dropping views over Central Park and beyond are just fabulous. Are they full of gizmos and gadgets? No thank God, they are the bedrooms of an owner with exquisite taste. The bar, the cafe, the restaurant are all outstanding in every respect and again with outstanding service with great classic and simple food, perfectly presented. The cafe buzzes with its line up of evening cabaret and I don't think I have ever seen a bad performance. Most recently Sutton Foster and Judy Collins offered two very different evenings but both were brilliant and brought the place alive. The spa is very good with great therapists and great amenities. My only gripe is that I don't think their laundry service is as good as it could be, shirts come back without that refreshed look and perfect press that say the George V delivers in Paris. Please make that one small improvement and I shall be ready to move in for good.

Reviews.Title: “Peace and tranquility is possible in New York!!”
Reviews.Author: Arlene&Co
Reviews.Content: Would you expect anything other than a class hotel in the historic upper east side? The small revolving door on East 76th leads to an impressive art deco floored reception area with inviting furniture, check in was super efficient and discreet, the attended lifts are small but its a 1930's building. I found all staff to polite and super efficient we had a recently renovated room apparently, it was on floor 19 not much of a view but never mind, lovely and spotllessly clean nice small luxury bathroom , nice wooden floor with rugs in the rest of the living areas plenty of storage space very comfy bed the housekeeping was superb (never saw anybody though)! We had a toilet that we struggled to flush this was sorted within 5 minutes after a phone call so thanks for that. We never had chance really to eat in the hotel but of course you require a Jacket or smart casual dress in the bar. The nearest subway is just 5 mins walk away on Lexington and 77th just past the Lennox Hill hospital , central park is 5 mins walk away remember your location you are on the corner of Madison and 76th, 5th Ave one side (West) and Park Ave (East) the other so its not going to be cheap you dont get hustle and bustle and bright lights and traffic noise and late night revellers this is a high end residential neighbourhood, when you do walk out the hotel smile or speak to the regular crowd of friendly paparazzi etiquette will not allow me to mention names but I'm sure you can research in a few clicks on you p.c!! If you want to do the tourist spots and the shopping then relax in another world in the evening away from it all (I think it was 10 mins on the subway from Times sq) then stay here if you want a I love New York tee shirt and a hot dog stalls every 2 metres or right outside your hotel then don't! As for local places there is a really nice cafe on the corner of 79th and Madison about 2 mins walk from hotel called Nectar very nice cafe small tables but nice food, also more pricey but superb is Sant Ambroeus just down from the Carlyle on Madison very popular with locals and famous guests. Million dollar question would I stay here again? YES. My only minor gripe I would liked to have had tea/coffee facilities in the room I expected them I think we had them in the Waldorf but the Carlyle is the better of the two in my book well done Rosewood Hotels see you again!!!!! Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Classy, but too old fashioned for me”
Reviews.Author: 2travelingscientists
Reviews.Content: I knew from the reviews that this hotel would be old style formal, but I had a meeting nearby and wanted something in walking distance. The Carlyle is nice but over priced and kind of stuffy. Stuffy formal and stuffy needing to be aired out and maybe a dehumidifier run. The lobby is nice, I actually like the decor there. The room decor was not to my style. Admittely I prefer contemporary. So the french provinical furniture, damask rose covered chair, windows laden with curtains that once opened ovelook an alley, and a tiny bathroom did not excitement me. Bath products are Keihl's -nice. The bed was wonderful and I slept like a baby. The elevators really surprised me, tiny, yet operated old school by a hotel operator. They push the puttons for you! I found it very weird. The hotel has a decent workout facility. I didn't check out the spa or restaurant. The location is terrific on the upper east side near Central Park. I would recommend this hotel if you are planning to take your parents or grandparents for a visit to NYC, they might enjoy the Carlyle.

Reviews.Title: “Old upper east side history; overpriced”
Reviews.Author: erdocmdca
Reviews.Content: Had one unexpected overnight in NYC and wanted a 5-star, so I took a chance with priceline and ended up with the Carlyle. I should confess that if I'm spending bucks, I like newer updated places, like the Mandarin chain, some of the Four Seasons properties, and funky places like the Hotel on Rivington. The Carlyle is an old upper east side throw-back. Apparently it's Sarkozy's digs when he's in the city. The bar is historic and charming. On arrival, my room wasn't ready, so the staff put me in the bar and comped me a martini. The room was spacious by NYC standards, but really old and dated. It had obviously been set up with twin beds! Lucy and Desi style! They pushed them together with an overlay to make a king bed for me, though. Exposed heating duct pipes and painted over wires along the floor and under the window. The chrome and old marble bathrooms were straight out of a "high class" 60's movie. My impression is that it's a hang-out for moneyed folks looking for exclusivity and subtlety. Interesting experience, but not remotely worth the expense ($750/night).

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: ontheroadagain0009
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel. Used to stay at one or another top hotel in NYC but will now become a regular here. Attentive staff, great location, love the food and the cabaret room.

Reviews.Title: “Went for the Spa”
Reviews.Author: cromwell76
Reviews.Content: I went to the spa for a discounted service they were promoting in during the winter and the spa/salon was extremely busy. They have you change in their tiny men's locker/shower/bathroom and come out in public wearing a robe. They have you sit in a public "relaxation" room where I ended up sitting next to 2 strangers wearing robes too! I felt embarrassed and uncomfortable. So as I got picked up by the therapist, you have all these salon clients walking in and out of the salon and looking at you wear your robe. I felt even more embarrassed, not to mention rude in front of so many woman! I didn't like the way they has me setup, but the massage I had there was great. Their massage therapist Lilly was fanominal. Except the prices for the services there. They were somewhere around $175 or so for a 60min massage. I was a little icky about that. But overall the spa was a little uncomfortable and disturbing, but the service i received was great!

Reviews.Title: “Classic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LUXEWEDDING
Reviews.Content: The Carlyle is really like a New York institution on the Upper East Side. Judy Collins was playing at the bar during our stay, Woody Allen's Jazz band plays Monday nights and it's really just full of old school New York history. From the elevator attendants to the impeccable service, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Granted, for any older hotel, there will be some imperfections starting to show. Our room was a bit outdated but still very nice. The bathroom was fabulous, including the Kiehls products, which for me, were a bonus, and compared to other hotels that I've stayed in while in Manhattan, this was by far the largest room i've ever stayed in. For a touch of class in your New York experience, the Carlyle is a great option.

Reviews.Title: “Will not choose the Carlyle for our next stay in NYC.”
Reviews.Author: SeattleDoctor
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have travel all around the world and have stayed at the most elegant and exquisite hotels. We read about the Carlyle in Conde Naste Magazine (fairly reliable source). We arrived around 8:00 p.m. and expected to be briefed on the amenitiesâ€™ of the hotel (Spa, fitness center, restaurant, complimentary house car, etc.,). We checked in and were left to explore the hotel on our own. We had to call down to the front desk to ask what time breakfast was served, where it was located, where the fitness room was etc.,. Very poor delivery from the beginning. We checked into our room 4 hours after check in to find the maid still servicing our room. Our room had a lovely view of the city, but was outdated and the paint on the ceiling of the bathroom was peeling. The daily breakfast buffet was adequate and offered a variety of items. The only redeeming quality was the concierge who was able to get us into all of the restaurants (Gramercy Tavern, Babbo, and Blue Hill)that we wanted to eat at (we did schedule 2 months in advance ). Bottom line: hotel was nothing special and lacked the service and quality that we are accustomed to. Next time I will pay more to stay at the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “The classy Carlyle”
Reviews.Author: nikoletPrague
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a brilliant location, with gorgeous views over the park. We had a lovely room spacious, comfortable, good facilities. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful. The drinks in the hotel were good, but my favorite was 5 o"clock tea. I think it is the best in New york!!! The hotel was clean & tidy.Carlyle takes the prize for classiest hotel in town. We really enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here with our wedding party and it was the best ever!”
Reviews.Author: zazzymcgrazz
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I stayed here at our recent wedding in New York. We were upgraded to a two-bedroom, three-bathroom suite with a massive living room and balcony that overlooks Madison Avenue. The suite was perfection down to every detail -- the Steinway grand piano, the fireplace, down-filled sofas, flatscreen TVs in every room, etc. The walls must be thick there, because our suite was silent and serene. The staff, from the Guest Experience Manager down to the bellhops, went above and beyond to make our stay the most memorable I have had (and I've stayed at a good number of 5-star hotels around the world). We were greeted by personal notes from the hotel manager. They sent up bottles of champagne for us and our wedding party. The night of our wedding, we found our pillowcases embroidered with my and my wife's *new* initials! I should also add that we were sharing the hotel with French President Sarkozy, his wife Carla Bruni, and Sir Paul McCartney, among others. I had a special moment when I ended up in the hotel's small gym, alone except for President Sarkozy, his wife and their trainer! Talk about a star sighting. I can't imaging how our experience there could have been better. It is an old-school, classy - and classic - luxury hotel in Manhattan and it lives up to its reputation as one of the best.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: arakashi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Carlyle on our wedding night. It was amazing. We looked at numerous hotels in the city, and I've stayed in many luxury hotels, and this one took the cake. I loved the old New York feel; the lobby is beautiful, the room was gorgeous (I booked a superior room, and the upgraded us to a superior suite without us even having to ask when I told them it was our wedding), with dark hard wood floors and light plush furniture, was very comfortable and HUGE for NY standards with tons of closets, 2 marble bathrooms, a kitchen, living room and very large bedroom with an incredibly comfortable bed (and I am very picky about beds). My girls and I ordered lunch while getting ready and it was delivered very quickly and was good. The concierge and bell hops were attentive and the service was very fast and polite, despite the fact that the President of France, Nicolas Sarkozy, was also staying at the hotel, which I thought might cause them to pay less attention to us. Quite the contrary, they were fabulous and so nice. We ate breakfast in the Gallery (Eggs Benedict) and it was super romantic and also one of the best hollandais sauces I've had. Thank you so much for making our wedding day, night and next morning so special! We couldn't have been happier.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: scrsteve27
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in a superior apartment. The room was very large with plenty of storage space. We were facing the courtyard which we did not particularily mind, as it meant a quiet room, or so I thought! The noise from the air conditioner unit was very loud. The apartment had fresh flowers in, the toiletries were kiehl's, the towels fluffy, all in all a wonderful stay. One thing that really did spoil it was on our last day, in the morning the maid knocked on our door, and without actually blatantly asking for a tip, it was as bad as, she kept asking if the room was up to our standard, which of course it was, nevertheless we did not expect the maid to knock on the door and blatantly ask for a tip. The hotel should train their staff a bit better! In the 21st century and in the USA I did expect the hotel to provide complimentary wifi, but was dissapointed that it did not. I can not remember the price of connecting, but it was expensive. Room service was a ridiculous price, almost $25 for a pot of coffee, the mini bar prices were unbelievable, a small bottle of water was around $9 (you can get a large bottle of exactly the same brand for $2 in the local shops!) The Carlyle has an understated elegance, and definitly worth the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Do not book in after 6pm!”
Reviews.Author: richardson30
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 8:30pm, booked through Expedia and unfortunately arrived on a day when the hotel was full so we ended up spending our first night in the last room available which was tiny - having booked a deluxe room - which is 50m2 in the brochure we ended up in a 12' x 12' nightmare of a room. Bing an Expedia client we were bottom of the barrel. We were upgraded to premier room the next day for another three nights but am afraid the damage has been done and after visiting The Carlyle a number of times I cannot face another experience like the one I just had. I missed a whole morning and lunchtime changing rooms or rather waiting to change rooms. Stupid front desk staff who tried to tell me that it had a lovely view in the room the size of a closet - when infact if you sit down you see nothing. Make sure you ring ahead a ask for a lower floor where rooms are much larger and have rooms over Madison Ave.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Beat The Carlyle!”
Reviews.Author: afficionado92
Reviews.Content: This hotel is without doubt one of the best places to stay in New York and for sure the Upper East Side. The hotel looks large on the outside but feels so intimate on the inside. From the moment you walk in the lobby on 76th Street, you are transformed into a world of "old money' elegance. The lobby staff is right on the bit and is so welcoming. The concierge is extremely helpful securing restaurant reservations and theatre tickets. The Carlyle Restaurant is the next location where whether you want breakfast, lunch or dinner, perfection is what you get on a plate. The setting is to die for! Then, the Gallery is the perfect place to take afternoon tea. It is not showy like the Plaza's Palm Court or the Pierre's Rotunda. The Benelman's Bar is very intimate and a perfect place for a drink before or after a night a the theatre or a nice dinner. Now to the room part, we always stay in various suites. They are so tastefully decorated and spacious. The new Sense spa is great for a massage as well. The Carlyle is a prime example of a typical New York luxury hotel. When you stay there it feels like you live there. Within walking distance to Polo Ralph Lauren, the Met, and many other incredible Madison Avenue boutiques.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible staff, dated decor”
Reviews.Author: brendastarlet
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Carlyle is as good as any staff in any hotel in the world. The location is amazing -- steps from Central Park in one of the most expensive neighborhoods in NYC. We had fresh flowers, linens, lovely toiletries, and delicious food. It's a special treat. But the rooms are showing their age, with very traditional decor (think your wealthy grandmother's house.) At this price level, I expect up to date furnishings, and a spacious bathroom. While the bathrooms have been renovated, they are as small as I've had in hotels costing one-third as much. The hotel would need a renovation before I could give it all five stars.

Reviews.Title: “thank you Carlyle for checking our bags when the Met Museum wouldn't”
Reviews.Author: Manningjen
Reviews.Content: After the Metropolitan Museum wouldn't let us check our suitcases (they said they were too bigt) & turned us away, the Carlyle several blocks away let us do it instead.

Reviews.Title: “Old Dame needs a re-do”
Reviews.Author: tcoop92
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at the Carlyle based on what we had heard, beautiful and old! This hotel would have been great 10-20 years ago but didn't think so today. First off, location is mediocre. The only thing of interest within walking distance was the head Ralph Lauren and Met Museum. Secondly, service was ok. The concierge were very helpful and polite but the front desk were snooty and housekeeping totally useless. The room, had a two bedroom suite, on a high floor and could see the Park but very old and on the smaller side. The dining room was beautiful for dinner but rather bad value. Expensive as other restaurants such as La Grenouille which have much better dinners. The Gallery was nice for afternoon tea, certainly better than the Plaza's Palm Court but the best is still the St Regis' Astor Court! Would go back if they had a major renno!

Reviews.Title: “Unprofessional new manager and rude head of housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: TrueReview10
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in some of the finest hotels all over the world including the Peninsala and Shangri-la in Hong Kong as well as the Savoy in London and the Hotel Crillon in Paris. The new manager at the Carlyle, Georg Unseld, is unprofessional, and the head of housekeeping, Leigh Gansburg, is the epitome of rudeness. Both employees misled me and outright lied to me. They both have zero integrity, and as long as they are both employed by the Carlyle, I will never step foot in the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A haven in New York City”
Reviews.Author: barbaraGeneva
Reviews.Content: I had always wanted to stay at the Carlyle, home to the Cafe Carlyle, one of my favorite secrets in New York, and home to so many interesting international visitors.
